articles.title: Late drama as India Women‚Äôs Hockey Team records 3-2 win over England to start FIH Hockey Pro League campaign on a high
creator: Sambad English Bureau
articles.description: Bhubaneswar: In a thrilling encounter, the Indian Women‚Äôs Hockey Team defeated England 3-2 in their opening match of the FIH Women‚Äôs Pro League at the Kalinga Stadium on Saturday. Vice Captain Navneet Kaur sealed the victory with a decisive late winner. Vaishnavi Vitthal Phallke (6‚Äô), Deepika (25‚Äô), and Navneet Kaur (59‚Äô) found the net for India, while Darcy Bourne (12‚Äô) and Fiona Crackles (58‚Äô) scored for England.Two of India‚Äôs goals came from penalty corners, showcasing an improvement in an area that has often been considered their Achilles' heel.The first quarter was tightly contested, with both teams scoring once. India took the lead in the 6th minute after earning the first penalty corner of the match. Manisha Chauhan‚Äôs initial shot was blocked by England‚Äôs first rusher, Tessa Howard. The rebound fell to Sushila Chanu, who unleashed a powerful shot that was smartly deflected into the net by Vaishnavi Vitthal Phallke. After a brief review, the goal was awarded to India.England responded in the 12th minute, cSAapitalizing on a defensive lapse. Vaishnavi lost possession inside the shooting circle, allowing Maddie Axford to take a shot, which was initially saved by goalkeeper Savita. However, Darcy Bourne reacted quickly to slot home the rebound, leveling the score. Towards the end of the first quarter, Tessa Howard fired a powerful shot from the left, but Savita produced a strong save to keep the score tied at 1-1.The second quarter remained tightly contested. India dominated possession, moving the ball swiftly with accurate passing, while England pressed high and won the ball in dangerous areas. In the 25th minute, India earned their second penalty corner, which was expertly converted by young drag-flick sensation Deepika, who marked her milestone 50th international appearance with a crucial goal.The third quarter was an entertaining end-to-end battle, with both sides attacking aggressively. India focused on controlling the midfield, while England attempted to exploit the flanks. Katie Curtis stood out for England, using her stick skills to advance the ball, but India remained resolute in defense, intercepting key passes. In the 42nd minute, India earned another penalty corner, and Deepika unleashed a powerful shot, only to be denied by the English goalkeeper.England gained momentum in the final quarter, earning three consecutive penalty corners, but failed to convert any of them. Their relentless pressure finally paid off in the 58th minute when Fiona Crackles found the equalizer.However, India responded almost immediately. Just a minute later, Vice Captain Navneet Kaur struck powerfully from the edge of the shooting circle, sending the ball through the goalkeeper‚Äôs legs and into the net. The late goal secured a dramatic 3-2 victory for India, earning them three points to start their campaign on a high.All the FIH Pro League 2024-25 matches will be streamed live on Hotstar and broadcast on Star Sport Select 2.

articles.title: While world hails efficient management at Maha Kumbh, SP, Congress & opposition spew venom against it
creator: WEB DESK
articles.description: As Maha Kumbh 2025 witnesses an unprecedented gathering of over 50 crore devotees, the world is applauding the seamless organization, safety measures, and digital innovations implemented by the Yogi Adityanath government. From state-of-the-art facilities to an efficient lost-and-found system that has reunited thousands with their families, the event has set a new global benchmark for crowd management and spiritual harmony. However, instead of appreciating this historic feat, opposition parties like the Samajwadi Party (SP) and Congress, along with Islamist propagandists, have resorted to slander and misinformation. SP MP Afzal Ansari‚Äôs remark about sins being washed at Mahakumbh, hell will be empty backlashes Samajwadi Party MP Afzal Ansari has ignited a political storm with his controversial statements about the Maha Kumbh 2025, drawing widespread criticism from religious leaders and the public. Ansari mocked the Sanatan Dharma and stated that if a holy dip at the Triveni Sangam cleanses sins, sarcastically stating that if everyone bathed, ‚Äúheaven would be houseful,‚Äù implying that no one would remain in hell. His comments were perceived as an insult to the Sanatan Dharma and the sentiments of millions of devotees. Further, he questioned the government‚Äôs handling of the event, alleging an underreporting of stampede casualties. He also made derogatory remarks about sants and sadhus, suggesting widespread cannabis consumption at the Kumbh Mela. His statements have triggered public outrage, with many demanding an apology. Meanwhile a case was filed against Afzal Ansari by Dev Prakash Singh, a resident of Budhpur village of Birno police station area. While addressing the gathering, Afzal Ansari said, ‚ÄúOn this festival of faith (Mahakumbh), it is believed that a person will become pure by bathing at the Sangam shore. Sins will be washed away. If sins are washed away, it means that the path to Baikunth will open up. In the situation that is visible, it seems that no one will survive in hell. No one will survive in hell and there (in Baikunth) the house will be full.‚Äù In wake of the controversial remarks made by Ansari, a case has been registered against him under Section 299 and Section 353(2) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS)1. Mallikarjun Kharge, President of the Congress Party in dock Congress party leaders are known for their anti-Sanatan Dharma rant. One such leader who openly denounced the Mahakumbh is the President of the Congress Party Mallikarjun Kharge who asked that if one takes the holy dip at Triveni Sangam, then will that help him to come out of poverty. He also stated that the BJP and its leaders were merely using Mahakumbh to click their pictures. ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•á ‡§≠‡§æ‡§à ‡§ó‡§Ç‡§ó‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§°‡•Å‡§¨‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§≤‡§ó‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§∏‡•á ‡§ó‡§º‡§∞‡•Ä‡§¨‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞ ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à ‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ, ‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ü‡§™‡§ï‡•ã ‡§™‡•á‡§ü ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ñ‡§æ‡§®‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§≤‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? ‡§Æ‡•à‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§ï‡•ã‡§à ‡§†‡•á‡§∏ ‡§®‡§π‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡§π‡•Å‡§Å‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡§æ ‡§ö‡§æ‡§π‡§§‡§æ‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§ó‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ ‡§π‡•Å‡§Ü ‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•à‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§´‡§º‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§π‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•Ç‡§Å‡•§ ‡§≤‡•á‡§ï‡§ø‡§® ‡§Ü‡§™ ‡§¨‡§§‡§æ‡§á‡§è ‡§ï‡§ø ‡§ú‡§¨ ‡§¨‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§ñ‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§∞ ‡§∞‡§π‡§æ ‡§π‡•à, ‡§¨‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•Ç‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§®‡§π‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§æ ‡§∞‡§π‡§æ ‡§π‡•à, ‡§Æ‡§ú‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•ã... pic.twitter.com/tQlf8XqBSI ‚Äî Mallikarjun Kharge (@kharge) January 27, 2025 Post the remark made by Kharge, the netizens took Kharge head and and posted pictures of former and late PM of India Jawaharlal Nehru who was seen taking holy bath at Sangam during Mahakumbh. ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§Ç‡§ó‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡§∞‡§ï‡•á ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ó‡§º‡§∞‡•Ä‡§¨‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§§‡•á ‡§π‡•Å‡§è ‡§ú‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§∞ ‡§≤‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§®‡•á‡§π‡§∞‡•Ç! pic.twitter.com/21bAHCUOhd ‚Äî Rishi Bagree (@rishibagree) January 28, 2025 BJP leader, Sambit Patra came down heavily on Khargey for hurting the sentiments of the large number of Hindus and asked Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, if they would make such outlandish remarks against other religions also. Patra urged the Congress leaders to apologise for their ant-Sanatan Dharma rant. SP leader Jaya Amitabh Bachchan Once Again Puts Her Foot In Her Mouth Samajwadi leader and Rajya MP Jaya Amitabh Bachchan took to the floor of the house and made a baseless remark about the holy water of Sangam Triveni being contaminated and the bodies of those who had died in the stampede that happened on the occasion of Mauni Amavasya were thrown in the river Ganga. In response to Jaya Amitabh Bachchan‚Äôs controversial statement BJP MP Arun Govil, hit back at Samajwadi Party (SP) MP Jaya Bachchan‚Äôs remarks on Mahakumbh, questioning her claims about contaminated water and bodies of stampede victims being thrown into the river. Govil demanded proof from Bachchan, stating that without evidence, she had no right to make such statements and claimed her remarks as baseless accusations. ‚ÄúHas she given any proof? She has not given anything, so she has no right to say all this,‚Äù he said while speaking with ANI. He further accused the opposition of having no interest in India‚Äôs culture, religion, or Sanatan, but rather only seeking to politicize issues. ‚ÄúThe opposition has nothing to do with our culture, religion, Sanatan, they only want to do politics,‚Äù said the BJP MP. A netizen posted a video defying Jaya Bachhan‚Äôs claim. This video is a tight slap on people like Jaya Bachchan who think that Mahakumbh is polluting Maa Ganga river ü§° pic.twitter.com/jnhmptGjfi ‚Äî Sunanda Roy üëë (@SaffronSunanda) February 15, 2025 Earlier, Parmarth Niketan Ashram President Swami Chidanand Saraswati responded to the remarks made by Jaya Bachchan concerning the Maha Kumbh, and expressed sadness over raising ‚Äúsuch questions‚Äù while being in the Parliament. He emphasised that the issue was not political and it was about the country and praised the massive celebration that has brought together crores of devotees, including foreigners while appreciating the Indian police for their calm and life-saving efforts during a recent stampede incident. Sharad Sharma, the VHP media in-charge,described Jaya‚Äôs remarks as an insult to Hindu traditions, and called her claims as baseless and misleading, asserting that the Maha Kumbh is a sacred event deeply rooted in Dharma, Karma, and Moksha, and such allegations hurt the sentiments of crores of Hindu devotees. Akhilesh Yadav forgot about stampede during his rule, blames UP govt for mismanagement In wake of the stampede that occurred at Mahakumbh due to overcrowding and breaking of barricades, SP leader Akhilesh Yadav quickly jumped onto [...]

articles.title: Meg Lanning's Delhi Capitals Face Off Against Harmanpreet Kaur's Mumbai Indians in WPL Clash
articles.description: Meg Lanning's Delhi Capitals Face Off Against Harmanpreet Kaur's Mumbai Indians in WPL Clash In a high-stakes encounter at Vadodara, Delhi Capitals' captain Meg Lanning won the toss and chose to bowl against the formidable Mumbai Indians in the Women's Premier League clash. Aiming for their maiden title, the Capitals, under Lanning's experienced leadership, are keen to start their 2023 campaign on a winning note.Adding to the excitement, Delhi introduces two promising talents: Niki Prasad, the U19 Women's T20 World Cup winner, and the Scottish wicketkeeper-batter, Sarah Bryce. Lanning emphasized the team's readiness and highlighted their potential, hoping to put forth a strong team performance despite recent health challenges faced by the squad.On the opposing side, Mumbai Indians, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, are determined to continue their bold and successful brand of cricket that earned them the title last season. Kaur expressed confidence in her team‚Äôs tried and tested strategies, focusing on maintaining their signature fearlessness while integrating a new debutant to bolster their lineup.

articles.title: Alert Assistant Saves Union Minister from Phone Scam
articles.description: Alert Assistant Saves Union Minister from Phone Scam In a remarkable display of vigilance, Union Minister for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale narrowly escaped a phone scam designed to extort money under false pretenses. The incident unfolded while Athawale was visiting Bihar when he received a troubling call.The caller alleged that a vehicle transporting students from a school in Shirdi had met with an accident in Gondia, injuring several children and desperately needing funds for their treatment, supposedly at Mumbai's JJ Hospital. However, the discrepancies in the caller's story, such as the location of the accident shifting to Bhandara, aroused suspicion.Thanks to the astuteness of Athawale's assistant, Sachin Bhati, who conducted quick checks and advised against transferring money, the scam unraveled. Athawale, addressing reporters in Shirdi, committed to forwarding the caller's number to the home department for further investigation.

articles.title: 15 Years of My Name Is Khan EXCLUSIVE: Shah Rukh Khan-Kajol‚Äôs on-screen son Arjan Singh Aujla goes down memory lane: ‚ÄúSRK sir made my parents feel at ease by cracking jokes with them; Varun Dhawan sir ran across the field to get me a chocolate milkshake from Starbucks‚Äù
articles.description: The soulful film My Name Is Khan (2010) completed 15 years on February 12. The character of Sameer had a significant part in the film. His death leads to conflict between his mother Mandira (Kajol) and step-father Rizwan (Shah Rukh Khan); the latter even takes a life-changing journey to meet the President and inform him, ‚ÄúMy Name Is Khan And I Am Not A Terrorist‚Äù. Sameer was played by Arjan Singh Aujla, who was 12 during the shoot of the film. On My Name Is Khan‚Äôs 15th anniversary, he spoke exclusively with Bollywood Hungama about his memories and a lot more.How did you bag the role in the film?Before working in My Name Is Khan, I had acted in ads for Milo and other brands. There was a system in place then that those who click your photos would circulate it to different production houses. That‚Äôs how I was called for the audition. Initially, I was asked to audition for young Shah Rukh. The role was ultimately played by Adarsh Gourav. They called me and tested me for a different role. After auditioning me for 5 times, I was selected for the film.Did you know that you were auditioning for My Name Is Khan?No. I just knew that I was testing for a big banner film. One of my meetings was with Shanoo Sharma ma‚Äôam. I was a child and hence, I didn‚Äôt know who she was (laughs). Hence, I auditioned very normally.So, when did you learn that you were going to act in My Name Is Khan?I did once I was locked for the part. This is when I learned that it‚Äôs a Dharma film and that Karan Johar sir will be directing it. Further, I was told that Shah Rukh sir, Kajol ma‚Äôam are in it.How was it meeting Shah Rukh Khan for the first time?I met Shah Rukh sir a few days before the shoot commenced. A floor was hired at Mehboob Studios to get our photos clicked, the one which are framed in the house of Rizwan and Mandira in the film. I clearly remember that before Shah Rukh Khan entered, there was a rush among people. As soon as he entered the studio, everyone just stood still. They stopped running around. We took some pictures together. He was very kind. He was smoking and he asked me if that made me uncomfortable.How was it to shoot with Kajol?She was very genuine. She is high on energy ‚Äì always very peppy and quirky. There‚Äôs a scene in the film where my character has died. She is holding me and crying profusely. She nailed that shot in one take. There were no retakes. Even after Karan sir had yelled ‚ÄòCut‚Äô, she kept crying. She was into that moment. I can still remember that episode vividly.Kudos to her and also to you for not moving in that shot at all...(Laughs) I was told not to breathe. But that take went on and on and I somehow managed to stay still.The scene where Sameer dies is an action-packed one. How was it shooting it?It was great. We were shooting on a football field. During the preparations, I was playing football with someone as I was a child and too excited to be on the sets, that too in the USA. The unit instructed me that there would be a fight scene and the other kids would chase me and push me down. There was an action coordinator as the makers couldn‚Äôt even risk me getting a scratch. This is because we were shooting in the USA where laws are strict. One can‚Äôt even shoot beyond 8 hours with kids. There was a supervisor on the sets to ensure that children were not being overworked. Their job also entailed that if there were animals on the set, they could shoot only a certain number of times. 2-3 times, the supervisor also halted the shoot. I remember she said, ‚ÄúYou guys might hate me for this but this is my job. I am from the government. If I don‚Äôt do my job, I‚Äôll be in trouble.‚ÄùHow was it working with Shah Rukh Khan? Did he rehearse with you?Yes. There was a scene where we were required to play basketball. It took some 45 minutes to set up the shot. Shah Rukh sir asked me to rehearse the scene with him and also joke with him. He again asked me if it was okay if he smoked. He also asked me if I wanted coffee. He would always take care and make sure that I was comfortable. He also made my parents feel at ease by cracking jokes with them.How was it working with Karan Johar?He, too, was very kind and would go out of my way to make sure I was comfortable. He even took a lot of care of my parents. There was a funny instance. Varun Dhawan was one of the ADs. During the fight sequence on the football field, it was very hot. Karan sir asked me if I would like to have a chocolate milkshake from Starbucks. This was a time when Starbucks had not started in India and I was fascinated about it. Hence, I said yes to the offer. Karan sir immediately yelled Varun‚Äôs name. Varun Dhawan sir came running. He told him, ‚ÄúRun across the field, go to Starbucks and get a chocolate milkshake for Arjan‚Äù. I didn‚Äôt even know who he was. Also, Starbucks was located a bit away from our location. So, I was like, ‚ÄúWhy are you sending him so far‚Äù. Karan sir replied, ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs an AD. AD ka yehi job hota hai‚Äù. Hence, I used to brag to people that Varun Dhawan once got me coffee!During the fight scene, Karan sir had assigned an AD just for me to make sure I was fed fruits and water. Someone even stood with an umbrella as it was shot in scorching heat. I was severely sunburnt as well.When did you see the film for the first time?At the cast-and-crew screening held before the release. I went with my parents. They got very emotional seeing me getting beaten up and killed. Main toh has raha tha as I was a very mischievous child (laughs). Hence, the whole theatre was crying while me and my brother were chuckling.How was life after My Name Is Khan?My parents asked me to focus on my education. They advised me to wait till I grew up and then decide if I wanted to resume acting.You are now being managed by Dharma Cornerstone Agency (DCA). Has life come back full circle?Yes. When I got a call from them, I immediately agreed to be a part of it. I consider Dharma as a family as growing up, I have been in their circle. I have a lot of friends who work with the banner. I also got calls from other top agencies. But for me, DCA holds a lot of importance as I have done a Dharma film and also because DCA is an extension of the production house. I held a few meetings with Rajeev Masand sir. It made me realize that they wanted me to be with them. The other agencies gave me the impression that I was working for them. But it should be both ways. It should not be like main hi unke peechhe bhaag raha hoon; they should also work for me. DCA made me realize what they could do for me as an actor and how we can move together as a team.Tell us about your recent works and forthcoming projects.I have worked on a film, Slum Golf, which is available on Amazon Mini. My upcoming show is directed by Ken Ghosh and I am part of its primary cast. I also worked in a short film, co-starring Nitanshi Goel of Laapataa Ladies (2024) fame. It is directed by Sayantan Mukherjee and is currently doing festival rounds. Apart from these projects, I am also doing social media campaigns and ads.Also Read: 15 Years of My Name Is Khan EXCLUSIVE: Writer Niranjan Iyengar opens up on whether a film like this can be made in today‚Äôs times; also reveals, ‚ÄúInitially, I felt Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs physical gestures were exaggerated but when I saw the scenes, I realized he was BRILLIANT‚Äù

articles.title: Chhaava Box Office: Vicky Kaushal ‚Äì Rashmika Mandanna starrer collects Rs. 33.10 cr on Day 1; emerges as highest opening day grosser of 2025
articles.description: February 14, 2025, saw the much-anticipated release of Chhaava, a historical action drama directed by Laxman Utekar. Starring Vicky Kaushal as the legendary Maratha warrior Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, alongside Rashmika Mandanna, the film stormed the box office on its debut, emerging as the highest opening day grosser of the year so far. Chhaava raked in a staggering Rs. 33.10 crore on Day 1, leaving its competition far behind and setting a new benchmark for 2025 releases.With a powerful narrative adapted from Shivaji Sawant‚Äôs celebrated Marathi novel by the same name, Chhava, resonated strongly with audiences, particularly in Maharashtra and other key territories. With an opening that more than doubles the second-best grosser, Sky Force that collected Rs. 15.30 crore, Chhaava has firmly positioned itself as the front-runner in the 2025 box office race. The film‚Äôs debut has also surpassed many high-profile releases from previous years, showcasing the enduring appeal of historical sagas when executed with grandeur and authenticity.Several factors contributed to Chhaava‚Äôs historic success, like Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs intense performance following his critically acclaimed portrayals in films like Sardar Udham and Sam Bahadur, Kaushal‚Äôs depiction of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj struck a chord with audiences. Director Laxman Utekar known for films like Mimi and Luka Chuppi, delivered a visually stunning and emotionally gripping tale of valour, coupled with Rashmika Mandanna‚Äôs pan-India appeal and of course the film‚Äôs historical relevance.The film opened across a massive number of screens country wide, accompanied by aggressive promotions and positive word-of-mouth. This along with the fact that being a story based on a Maratha warrior, Chhaava opening to a thunderous start within the state of Maharashtra. With theatres going houseful in the state, the business of Chhaava witnessed an exponential windfall from this territory on opening day.Going forward, with such an impressive opening, Chhaava is expected to maintain its strong momentum through the weekend. If the current trend continues, it may soon enter the Rs. 100 crore club within its first few days.Highest Opening Day Grossers of 2025 at a glance:Chhaava ‚Äì Rs. 33.10 croreSky Force ‚Äì Rs. 15.30 croreGame Changer ‚Äì Rs. 6.75 croreDeva ‚Äì Rs. 5.78 croreBadass Ravi Kumar ‚Äì Rs. 3.52 croreFateh ‚Äì Rs. 2.61 croreEmergency ‚Äì Rs. 2 croreAzaad ‚Äì Rs. 1.40 croreLoveyapa ‚Äì Rs. 0.75 crore

articles.title: Chhaava Box Office: Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs Chhaava destroys records, wipes out past Valentine‚Äôs Day grossers to become the ALL-TIME HIGHEST Valentine‚Äôs Day opener!
articles.description: Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs latest release, Chhaava, has not only set a new benchmark at the box office but has also emerged as the all-time highest Valentine‚Äôs Day grosser. The historical action film, directed by Laxman Utekar, raked in a massive Rs. 33.10 crore on its first day, surpassing all previous films that released on Valentine‚Äôs Day. Featuring Rashmika Mandanna in a pivotal role, the film is based on the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the son of the legendary Shivaji Maharaj. An adaptation of the Marathi novel Chhava by Shivaji Sawant, the film has struck a chord with audiences, particularly in Maharashtra, where its collections saw an exponential rise.Collecting Rs. 33.10 crore on opening day, Chhaava has outperformed previous releases like Gully Boy that collected Rs. 19.40 crore by a huge margin and nearly doubled the collection of Gunday that had collected Rs. 16.12 crore, which previously held the second spot. Even blockbuster romantic films like Love Aaj Kal and Roy, which were Valentine‚Äôs Day successes, fell significantly behind in comparison. In fact, with Chhaava outperforming previous Valentine‚Äôs Day releases, Vicky Kaushal has now managed to exceed several major Bollywood superstars like Ranveer Singh, Akshay Kumar, Arjun Kapoor, and Shah Rukh Khan who have had releases on the same date.This massive box office success is currently being attributed to the fact that the film is deeply rooted in Maratha history, thanks to this it witnessed a phenomenal response in Maharashtra, with audiences turning out in record numbers. Early estimates suggest that Maharashtra alone contributed nearly Rs. 18-20 crore to the opening day total, the highest regional contribution for any Vicky Kaushal film.The grand success of Chhaava further cements Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs status as a box-office powerhouse. His transition from delivering content-driven hits to commanding record-breaking numbers showcases his growing star power. Currently, trade states that the film‚Äôs extraordinary opening indicates that Chhaava is poised for a long and successful box-office run, potentially becoming one of the biggest blockbusters of 2025. But one thing for certain is that with its unprecedented success on Valentine‚Äôs Day, Chhaava has redefined historical action dramas and reaffirmed the audience‚Äôs appetite for powerful storytelling.Top 10 All-Time Highest Valentine‚Äôs Day Grossers:Chhaava ‚Äì Rs. 33.10 croreGully Boy ‚Äì Rs. 19.40 crore (-41.4% lower than Chhaava)Gunday ‚Äì Rs. 16.12 crore (-51.3% lower than Chhaava)Love Aaj Kal ‚Äì Rs. 12 crore (-63.7% lower than Chhaava)Roy ‚Äì Rs. 11.16 crore (-66.3% lower than Chhaava)Jolly LLB 2 ‚Äì Rs. 9.07 crore (-72.6% lower than Chhaava)Pad Man ‚Äì Rs. 7.05 crore (-78.7% lower than Chhaava)Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya ‚Äì Rs. 6 crore (-81.9% lower than Chhaava)Fitoor ‚Äì Rs. 5.96 crore (-82% lower than Chhaava)Pathaan ‚Äì Rs. 5.60 crore (-83.1% lower than Chhaava)

articles.title: Chhaava Box Office: Film collects Rs. 33.10 cr on Day 1; emerges as Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs all-time highest opening day grosser
articles.description: Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs latest release, Chhaava, has stormed the box office, emerging as his all-time highest opening day grosser. The historical action film, directed by Laxman Utekar, raked in an impressive Rs. 33.10 crore on its first day, surpassing all his previous films by a significant margin. Said to be a historical action drama based on the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the son of the great Maratha warrior Shivaji Maharaj. The film is an adaptation of the celebrated Marathi novel Chhava by Shivaji Sawant and features Rashmika Mandanna in a pivotal role. Laxman Utekar, known for his successful directorial ventures, brings this gripping saga of valour and sacrifice to the big screen.With collections nearly three times higher than his second-best opener, Bad Newz that collected Rs. 8.62 crore, Chhaava has set a new benchmark for the actor. Compared to Uri: The Surgical Strike, one of Kaushal‚Äôs biggest career-defining films, Chhaava has achieved nearly four times the day-one collection. The film‚Äôs record-breaking numbers reaffirm Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs rising stature as a box-office force and demonstrate the audience‚Äôs appetite for well-executed historical dramas.As for the stunning opening day business of the film, trade states that given the film‚Äôs deep-rooted connection to Maratha history, it witnessed an exponential rise in collections in Maharashtra, where audiences turned out in massive numbers. The film‚Äôs impact was particularly strong in Pune, Mumbai, and Nashik, reaffirming the state‚Äôs love for this historical epic. Early estimates suggest that Maharashtra alone contributed nearly Rs. 18-20 crore to the opening day figure, making it the highest regional contribution for any Vicky Kaushal film.With a phenomenal opening, Chhaava is poised for a strong weekend and a long box-office run. It is expected to cross major milestones in the coming days and could become one of the highest-grossing films of the year. As for Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs journey from delivering content-driven hits to achieving massive commercial success with Chhaava, the phenomenon showcases his ever-growing star power.Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs All-Time Highest Opening Day Grossers at a glance:Chhaava ‚Äì Rs. 33.10 croreBad Newz ‚Äì Rs. 8.62 crore (3.8x lower than Chhaava)Uri: The Surgical Strike ‚Äì Rs. 8.20 crore (4x lower than Chhaava)Raazi ‚Äì Rs. 7.53 crore (4.4x lower than Chhaava)Sam Bahadur ‚Äì Rs. 5.75 crore (5.8x lower than Chhaava)

articles.title: Chhaava Box Office: Vicky Kaushal starrer surpasses Padmaavat and Bajirao Mastani; emerges as all-time highest Historical opening day grosser
articles.description: Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs latest film, Chhaava, has rewritten box office history by emerging as the highest opening day grosser among historical dramas. The Laxman Utekar directorial raked in an impressive Rs. 33.10 crore on its first day, surpassing all previous historical epics. Featuring Rashmika Mandanna, the film brings to life the story of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the son of the legendary Maratha warrior Shivaji Maharaj. Adapted from the acclaimed Marathi novel Chhava by Shivaji Sawant, the film has struck a chord with audiences, particularly in Maharashtra, where its collections saw an exponential rise.Before Chhaava, several historical films made their mark with strong openings, but none could reach this milestone. However, with this staggering opening, the Vicky Kaushal ‚Äì Rashmika Mandanna starrer Chhaava has surpassed Padmaavat by Rs. 9.10 crore, which previously held the record among historical dramas. The film‚Äôs debut is more than double the opening of Tanhaji ‚Äì The Unsung Warrior that collected Rs. 15.10 crore and nearly three times Bajirao Mastani that collected Rs. 12.80 crore, two of the most beloved Maharashtra-centric period films.The film‚Äôs massive opening indicates an increasing demand for well-made historical dramas that resonate with audiences.If that was not enough, both Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior and Bajirao Mastani were highly successful Maharashtra-centric films, celebrating the valor of Maratha warriors. However, Chhaava took it to another level, registering an exponential rise in collections within Maharashtra, where audiences connected deeply with its historical narrative. The film‚Äôs Maharashtra share alone contributed nearly Rs. 18-20 crore, far exceeding what Tanhaji (Rs. 15.10 crore opening) and Bajirao Mastani (Rs. 12.80 crore opening) achieved nationwide.With Chhaava setting a new benchmark, it reaffirms the popularity of historical action dramas when executed with authenticity and grandeur. The film‚Äôs record-breaking opening has solidified Vicky Kaushal‚Äôs position as a box-office powerhouse, and its strong momentum suggests a long, successful run ahead. With Maharashtra backing this cinematic spectacle wholeheartedly, Chhaava is well on its way to becoming one of the biggest hits of 2025.Highest Opening Day Grossers among Historical releases:Chhaava ‚Äì Rs. 33.10 crorePadmaavat ‚Äì Rs. 24 croreTanhaji: The Unsung Warrior ‚Äì Rs. 15.10 croreBajirao Mastani ‚Äì Rs. 12.80 croreSamrat Prithviraj ‚Äì Rs. 10.70 crorePanipat ‚Äì Rs. 4.12 crore

articles.title: Kartik Aaryan teases intense role in Anurag Basu‚Äôs upcoming film: ‚ÄúYou will see an intense, never-seen-before side of me‚Äù
articles.description: Kartik Aaryan began his journey with unforgettable monologues in Pyaar Ka Punchnama, quickly winning over audiences with his effortless charm. Over time, he became synonymous with blockbuster romcoms, delivering hits like Pati Patni Aur Woh and tackling tongue-twisting titles such as Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety and the much-awaited Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri. But beyond the quirky titles and witty dialogues, his take on love remains refreshingly real. Whether on-screen or off, Rooh Baba believes in keeping matters of the heart simple and sincere.As Kartik gears up for an exciting slate of films, he promises to showcase a never-seen-before side of himself. Teasing his upcoming roles, he revealed, ‚ÄúEvery film I‚Äôve done has shown different shades of love ‚Äì some fun, some intense, some heartbreaking. And just like my characters, I‚Äôve evolved too. I think romance has always been my strong suit, and I‚Äôm grateful filmmakers see that, too. And honestly, my approach to relationships in real life helps me bring out the best on screen, too.‚ÄùHe added, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all connected, and it always reflects. Audiences and fans only connect with us as performers when we are able to bring that authenticity to our characters. You will see an intense, never-seen-before side of me in Basu da‚Äôs musical love story and then you will see me playing a fun, yet, a character with gravitas in Sameer Vidwans‚Äô Tu Mera Main Teri, Main Tera Tu Meri. 2025 is shaping up to be a romantic year for me.‚ÄùKartik Aaryan has Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri and Anurag Basu‚Äôs grand musical love story on the horizon.Also Read : Kartik Aaryan reminds me of my early days,‚Äù says Anupam Kher applauds Chandu Champion actor‚Äôs journey

articles.title: Chhaava Box Office: Vicky Kaushal starrer roars with an opening of Rs. 33.10 crores
articles.description: Chhaava has taken a very good opening at the box office. The film was in news en route release and while a good opening was definitely on the cards, things started looking better and better as the advance booking kickstarted. By the time Thursday came to a close, it was a given that the film will cross Rs. 20 crores mark and even Rs. 25 crores seemed possible.However, Valentine‚Äôs Day meant that many more younger couples lined up for the film as well. Though this isn‚Äôt a Valentine‚Äôs theme film, celebratory mood amongst youth meant that footfalls did see a push. As a result, the first day collections have come as Rs. 33.10 crores, which is really good. There is very good chunk of business, which has come from Maharashtra where the story is based, and that‚Äôs on expected lines as well. However, the overall numbers are still high which indicates that there is audience in rest of the country as well.The start has come for the Vicky Kaushal starrer and now it‚Äôs about sustaining from this point on. A Rs. 100 crores weekend is given for the film and if it sustains as well from Monday onwards then this could well turn out to be the first Rs. 200 Crore Club film of 2025.Note: All collections as per various box office sources

articles.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh highlights Lucknow‚Äôs growth as a key investment destination
articles.description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh lauded Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, stating that Uttar Pradesh is witnessing unprecedented development under his leadership. Highlighting the state's progress, he emphasized that efforts are underway to transform Lucknow into a global investment hub with world-class infrastructure. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Union Minister for Road Transport Nitin Gadkari inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for various development projects worth Rs 1,028 crore in Lucknow on Friday. During this, the Defence Minister said, ‚ÄúIn a recent international survey, Lucknow has been included among the fastest-growing cities in the world, with rapidly increasing land prices.‚Äù He also recalled the contributions of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, emphasizing that concrete steps have been taken to develop urban and rural infrastructure in Uttar Pradesh in line with his vision. The Defence Minister highlighted the significant increase in urban infrastructure investment, stating that between 2004 and 2014, only Rs 1.78 lakh crore was spent in this sector. However, under Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs leadership, from 2014 to 2024, the investment has surged to Rs 28.52 lakh crore. Emphasizing the expansion of the Lucknow Metro, he mentioned that the Charbagh to Vasant Kunj project is expected to receive approval soon. To improve traffic flow in the city, multiple flyovers and highways are being constructed. ‚ÄúA four-lane flyover from Polytechnic Chauraha to Munshipulia, built at a cost of Rs 170 crore, and another flyover from Indira Nagar to Khurramnagar, constructed at Rs 270 crore, have been inaugurated. Additionally, Rs 45 crore has been approved for the construction of a service road near Amar Shaheed Path,‚Äù he informed. The Defence Minister further mentioned that Lucknow‚Äôs railway network is being upgraded significantly. The renovation of Gomti Nagar Railway Terminal, Alamnagar Satellite Station, Aishbagh, and Badshahnagar Railway Station has been completed, while the modernization of Transport Nagar and Utraitia stations is underway. Expanding air connectivity, he mentioned that Lucknow Airport is being developed to enhance international flight services. He also said that the BrahMos missile manufacturing project, part of the Defence Corridor, will be inaugurated in May-June this year, marking a significant milestone in Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs industrial growth. He added that the Lucknow-Kanpur Expressway is being constructed rapidly, which will reduce travel time between the two cities to just 40 minutes. Rajnath Singh further highlighted the surge in religious tourism following the development of the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Temple and Kashi Vishwanath Corridor. He also stated that Lucknow is witnessing increased investment in real estate, the hotel industry, and healthcare. The Defence Minister requested Union Minister Nitin Gadkari to approve additional road and infrastructure projects for Lucknow, which were granted approval. He said that these initiatives will be milestones in transforming Lucknow into a world-class city and expressed confidence that in the coming years, Lucknow will rank among India‚Äôs top cities, with Uttar Pradesh playing a crucial role in the country‚Äôs economic progress.

articles.title: Mahakumbh 2025: Kumbh Mela Crowds Surge as No Vehicle Zone Imposed in Prayagraj for Weekends | ABP NEWS
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: Today marks the 34th day of the Mahakumbh, and the enthusiasm of devotees remains high. A new record was set yesterday, with over 50 crore people taking a holy dip, now officially recognized in the Guinness World Records. There are speculations that political leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi may visit the Mahakumbh soon to take a dip in the holy river. The scene is incredible, with roads and paths filled with devotees. This is surprising for the people of Prayagraj, as they typically expect fewer crowds after Basant Panchami. However, the crowds are still large. For those planning to visit on weekends, please note that no vehicles from other districts are allowed inside the Kumbh area. Visitors must park outside and walk to the site. Weekdays, from Monday to Friday, are relatively less crowded, but weekends remain busy. The crowd has been steadily increasing, especially after Basant Panchami.

articles.title: Immigrants' Legal Victory Temporarily Blocks Transfer to Guantanamo
articles.description: Immigrants' Legal Victory Temporarily Blocks Transfer to Guantanamo Three Venezuelan immigrants secured a restraining order against the federal government to stop their transfer to Guantanamo Bay. However, court documents reveal they were deported to Venezuela this week on direct flights.The deportations occurred the day after a temporary order was approved by a federal judge to block their transfer under President Trump's immigration measures.Lawyers argue their clients face grave threats due to baseless allegations of gang ties. Meanwhile, immigrant rights groups are challenging the lack of legal access for those sent to Guantanamo Bay.

articles.title: Odisha Congress to conduct Padayatra from Bhubaneswar to Puri Jagannath Temple on Feb 18
creator: Sambad English Bureau
articles.description: Bhubaneswar: Odisha Congress will hold Sankalpa Padayatra from Bhubaneswar to Puri on February 18. The Odisha Pradesh Congress Committee (OPCC) has urged all the party leaders and workers to participate in the Padayatra to be organised on Tuesday. ‚ÄúWe have decided to carry out a Sankalpa Padayatra from Bhubaneswar to Lord Jaganath Temple in Puri. The pada yatra will start from 18.2.2025 from Biju Patnaik airport. All leaders and party cadres are requested to actively participate in Sankalpa padayatra," the OPCC said on Friday.The OPCC also formed a committee to coordinate this Sankalpa Padayatra from Bhubaneswar to Puri.Ex-MLA Debasis Pattnaik will work as the Chairman of the 16-member committee which also comprises Ex-MLA Mohammed Moquim, congress legislators Ramesh Jena, Dasarathi Gomanga, C.S. Raazen Ekka, Kadraka Appala Swamy, Ashok Kumar Das etc.It is pertinent here to mention that the newly appointed OPCC president Bhakta Charan Das had launched `Padayatras' and Yatras on cycle several times throughout the state on different social issues.Meanwhile, Das in another significant decision on Friday revoked the suspension and expulsion orders issued against the party leaders in the past allowing them to rejoin the party.He also urged the former Congress leaders who had left the party in past for different reasons to come back."If they are willing to join the Congress party by showing faith in its policies and ideals, they will be welcomed with honour by the Congress party,‚Äù Das said on Friday.Notably, the All India Congress Committee on February 11 has appointed former union minister and veteran congress leader Das as the new president of OPCC. The senior Congress leader had earlier also served as the working president and general secretary of the OPCC. Das after getting appointed as the OPCC chief has asserted that he would work by taking along all the senior and junior leaders and workers of the party.(IANS)

articles.title: Book ‚Äì "The Hindu Sufis of South Asia‚Äù
creator: Syed Ali Mujtaba
articles.description: 'The Hindu Sufis of South Asia' by Michel Boivin explores the unique blend of Hindu and Sufi traditions among the Sindhi Hindu community in India. The book examines the community's sacred spaces, literature, and rituals, showcasing their ability to preserve a Hindu-Sufi identity despite the challenges posed by religious polarization. Published by Bloomsbury in 2019, this work is a significant contribution to understanding the complexities of Hindu-Muslim relations in South Asia.

articles.title: Controversy Surrounds FBI Amidst Allegations and Changes
articles.description: Controversy Surrounds FBI Amidst Allegations and Changes The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has branded the allegations of corruption against its agents as 'unfounded' and 'deeply irresponsible,' a statement released on Friday indicated. This rebuttal came after U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's social media remarks, which cited a Los Angeles Times report on immigration enforcement in Los Angeles.In a pointed message on Sunday, Noem had decried the FBI, vowing collaboration with other agencies to identify and prosecute purportedly 'crooked deep state agents.' The controversy traces back to former President Donald Trump's longstanding grievances with the FBI and Justice Department, a discontent exacerbated by the 2022 raid on Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate concerning presidential records.Despite Trump's eventual legal victories following his 2024 re-election, his administration continues to reshape the federal bureaucracy. Trump has nominated the controversial Kash Patel, known for advocating substantial changes to the top law enforcement institution, as the new head of the FBI. The Senate has not scheduled a debate on Patel's nomination.

articles.title: Justice Department Turmoil: A Modern-Day 'Saturday Night Massacre'
articles.description: Justice Department Turmoil: A Modern-Day 'Saturday Night Massacre' In a controversial move, a U.S. federal prosecutor has agreed to file a motion to dismiss corruption charges against New York City Mayor Eric Adams. This decision was intended to prevent job losses among career public integrity prosecutors but has triggered significant backlash within the Justice Department.Veteran prosecutor Ed Sullivan volunteered to file the motion to relieve his colleagues, though the decision is viewed by some as coercion rather than capitulation. Sullivan emerged as a figure of resistance amid growing tensions between career officials and political appointees.The resignations of six senior Justice Department officials, including Manhattan's top federal prosecutor, have highlighted a deepening dissent against what some describe as the agency's politicization under President Trump's influence. This echoes historical precedents of Justice Department defiance in maintaining its prosecutorial independence.

articles.title: Share Market Closes Lower, Sensex Under 75,950, Nifty Ends Over 100 Points Down. See Why Indices Tanked
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: The Indian stock markets reversed their trend and ended trading on Friday in red. The equity benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, closed down in their eighth consecutive trading session. The BSE Sensex settled for the day under 75,950, declining almost 200 points, while the NSE Nifty50 ended trading at 22,929,25, clocking a fall of a little over 100 points.On the 30-share Sensex platform, Nestle, ICICI Bank, Infosys, TCS, and HCL Tech emerged among the gainers in the session. On the other hand, the laggards in the day included Adani Ports, UltraTech Cement, Sun Pharma, IndusInd Bank, and NTPC. In the broader markets, multiple indices crashed over 3 per cent in the session. The Nifty Smallcap50 index plunged 3.81 per cent, followed by the Nifty Smallcap100 index which tanked 3.55 per cent.Sectorally, the Media index dominated in red and nosedived over 3 per cent, settling down by 3.40 per cent. The Pharma and Healthcare Index followed with losses of 2.87 per cent and 2.46 per cent respectively.Also Read : 'Heads Of States Don't Discuss Individuals': PM Modi Tells US Media On Adani QuestionWhy Did Markets Fall?This downfall was attributed to the wary sentiment prevalent among investors about the implications of reciprocal US tariffs. Notably, PM Modi met the US president and both countries committed to finalising the first phase of the trade deal by the end of the year and aimed to target bilateral trade at $500 million by 2030. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services, explained, "The risk-averse sentiment continues to rule investors‚Äô minds as corporate earnings are significantly lower than the market expectations during the start of the year, especially for mid and small caps. Muted earnings trend, INR depreciation along with external factors like tariffs are expected to keep the sentiments weak in the near term, which could further push FIIs outflows. Volatility is expected to stay elevated until there is clarity on tariffs and a recovery in corporate earnings."Macro Indicators The Indian rupee recovered and closed the session 12 paise higher at 86.81 (provisional) against the US dollar on Friday. Forex traders noted that elevated crude oil prices and consistent foreign fund outflows weighed down the domestic currency. The foreign institutional investors (FIIs) offloaded Indian equities worth Rs 2,789.91 crore on Thursday, according to exchange data. The global oil benchmark Brent crude climbed 0.55 per cent to touch $75.43 a barrel.

articles.title: Man kills neighbour woman by slitting throat in Odisha's Cuttack city
creator: Biswajeet Swain
articles.description: Cuttack: A man allegedly killed a neighbour woman by slitting her throat with a paniki (traditional vegetable cutter) at Potapokhari under CRRI police limits in Odisha's Cuttack city, today.The deceased was identified as Priyatama Dalai (35). The accused, identified as Santosh Kumar Sinha, absconded after committing the crime."A dispute was prevailing between the two over a fence between the two houses. He had recently threatened the woman to kill her. Today, the matter took a violent turn as the accused attacked her with a paniki, leaving her critically injured. Though we rushed the victim to the SCB Medical College and Hospital, she was declared dead," said Arun Kumar Swain, ACP, Zone-I, Cuttack."The attack on the woman took place when her husband was not present in the house. We have formed a team to trace and apprehend the accused," the police official added.

articles.title: NASA‚Äôs PRIME-1 Mission to Study Lunar Ice and Advance Moon Exploration
articles.description: NASA‚Äôs PRIME-1 mission, set to launch on Intuitive Machines‚Äô Athena lander, will explore lunar ice and subsurface materials at Mons Mouton near the Moon‚Äôs South Pole. The mission features the TRIDENT drill, which will extract soil samples up to one meter deep, and the MSOLO spectrometer, which will analyze gases released from these samples to detect water ice and other volatiles. Insights gained will support future Artemis missions by enabling the use of lunar resources for human exploration. PRIME-1 is part of NASA‚Äôs Commercial Lunar Payload Services (CLPS) initiative, aimed at fostering private sector participation in space exploration.

articles.title: 7 daily routine mistakes that blocks the road to success
articles.description: Success is not a destination or a one-night thing. It is a journey filled with consistent habits and challenges. A few habits that we have take us forward, and other habits act as roadblocks, breaking our progress. Surprisingly, many of those habits are found in our daily routines, and they are often unnoticed. Identifying these habits is crucial for unlocking your full potential for a successful life. Hitting Snooze: Whenever there is an alarm that reminds you to get up or do this task or go there or meet them, we often tend to snooze it for a minimum of 9 minutes, and the maximum is to cancel the plan. This practice disturbs your sleep cycle and also your daily tasks. This can impact your focus, productivity, and overall motivation throughout the day. Instead, train yourself to get up with the first alarm and embrace your morning. Skipping Breakfast: Breakfast is not just a meal; this meal is the fuel that powers your day. Skipping breakfast can lead to decreased concentration and lower energy levels. This can affect cognitive function. A nutritious breakfast that is packed with essential proteins and carbs provides you the energy for a productive day ahead. Multitasking Mania: Multitasking is often considered a superpower, and it might look efficient. But it is actually counterproductive. Switching between different tasks rapidly decreases concentration and increases errors on the work we do. Prioritize doing one thing at a time for better results and optimal efficiency. Reactive instead of Proactive: Spending your day reacting to your messages and emails will leave a little room for focusing on your work and goals. Being proactive is a process of planning your day, prioritizing tasks, and dedicating time blocks for important tasks. This allows you to maintain a consistent schedule for your work and progress. Neglecting Self-Care: You cannot pressurize yourself from all the possible ways to get things done and expect to succeed; that does not make any sense. This is not how it works, and you need to prioritize activities that recharge you, like exercise, meditation, spending time with loved ones, or simply enjoying a hobby. You need to prioritize your physical and mental well-being for unlocking your true potential, which is essential for long-term success. Procrastination: Putting off important tasks and postponing them can create a cycle of stress and anxiety that affects your work. This often starts from fear of failure and underconfident traits. You can breakdown large tasks into smaller ones to manageable steps. You can use the Pomodoro technique to stay focused for long-term success. Lack of Continuous Learning: With the constantly evolving world, you can‚Äôt just stay stagnant with your skills and talents. You need to constantly keep the habit of continuous learning by reading books or listening to podcasts. You can also take online courses to expand your knowledge and skills that keeps you relevant for career growth. By recognizing and addressing these common mistakes in your daily routine, you can make yourself better and strive towards greater productivity with increased focus. You can achieve your goals with the small changes in your daily habits that can lead to significant improvements in your success. articles.title: Valentine's Day: Shahid Kapoor in 'Jab We Met' to Arjun Kapoor in '2 States'; 5 rom-com heroes to fall for
articles.description: Bollywood rom-coms are nothing without their charming leading men‚Äîthe ones who make us laugh, and believe in love. This Valentine's Day let's take a look at those 5 rom-com heroes This Valentine‚Äôs Day, here are five rom-com heroes who stole hearts on screen and the movies you can watch them in! As Krish, Arjun Kapoor plays the perfect boyfriend‚Äîsincere, supportive, and willing to go to any lengths to win over his girlfriend‚Äôs strict South Indian family. His understated charm and emotional depth make him the guy you‚Äôd want on your side in a family showdown. Plus, his chemistry with Alia Bhatt is effortlessly natural! Shahid Kapoor‚Äôs Aditya Kashyap is the silent, brooding type who undergoes a major transformation thanks to Kareena Kapoor‚Äôs energetic Geet. From a heartbroken businessman to someone who learns to embrace life again, his understated intensity makes him an unforgettable rom-com hero. Bonus points for his killer smile, heartfelt performance Carefree, ambitious, and full of life, Ranbir as Bunny brings an irresistible charm to Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani. While he‚Äôs a little too focused on chasing his dreams at first, his eventual realization about love and friendships makes for a swoon-worthy arc Imran Khan‚Äôs Jai is the ultimate boy-next-door‚Äîsweet, funny, and completely oblivious to his own feelings. Watching him go from the ‚Äúbest friend‚Äù to the ‚Äúperfect boyfriend‚Äù is what makes Jaane Tu... Ya Jaane Na such a relatable and heartwarming watch. His easy-going charm and playful energy make him one of Bollywood‚Äôs most beloved rom-com leads Sidharth Malhotra‚Äôs Nikhil is the classic ‚Äúnice guy‚Äù who‚Äôs a little lost but has his heart in the right place. Caught between family expectations and an unexpected connection with Parineeti Chopra‚Äôs quirky scientist character, his warmth and sincerity make him a total heartthrob. Plus, his effortless charm makes even awkward moments feel endearing! So, which Bollywood rom-com hero is your Valentine‚Äôs Day mood?

articles.title: Xi Jinping's Symposium: Reviving China's Private Sector Amid Tensions
articles.description: Xi Jinping's Symposium: Reviving China's Private Sector Amid Tensions Chinese President Xi Jinping is preparing to host a pivotal symposium designed to invigorate the private sector, according to insider reports. This high-profile meeting, expected to occur next week, will see participation from key business figures like Alibaba's Jack Ma and Tencent's Pony Ma.The symposium comes at a time of heightened challenges for China's private sector, with growing tensions in Sino-U.S. relations and a sluggish domestic economy. Leaders from the technology industry are anticipated to receive encouragement from Xi to grow both domestically and abroad amid the ongoing technological rivalry with the United States.The conference marks Xi's rare direct engagement with the private sector since 2018, signaling a potential shift towards bolstering business confidence. The State Council Information Office and major companies involved have yet to comment on the event's specifics.

articles.title: Teen's Harrowing Ordeal in Karawal Nagar
articles.description: Teen's Harrowing Ordeal in Karawal Nagar A 17-year-old girl in northeast Delhi faced a traumatic experience when she was allegedly raped by her neighbor in Karawal Nagar, according to police reports on Friday.The alleged attack occurred on Thursday, around noon, when the accused summonsed her to a house in the area under the guise of needing assistance with work, and then assaulted her. The accused has since been arrested and the investigation is in progress, the police confirmed.The girl was promptly taken to GTB Hospital for a medical examination and received necessary counseling. Police registered a First Information Report (FIR) based on her account and medical findings, leading to the neighbor's apprehension.

articles.title: Fatal Dispute Over Roadside Birthday Bash
articles.description: Fatal Dispute Over Roadside Birthday Bash In a tragic incident in Pune, a 37-year-old man was shot dead following an altercation over a birthday celebration on the roadside. The incident, reported by local authorities on Friday, highlights escalating tensions during the late-night festivity at Dehu Road in the Pimpri Chinchwad area.The confrontation began when three to four individuals arrived on motorcycles, questioning the public celebration organized by the complainant, Nandkishor Yadav. As the dispute intensified, one of the assailants used a chair to strike Yadav in the face, prompting his friend, Vikram Guruswami Reddy, to intervene.Tragically, Reddy was shot during the mediation attempt. Despite being rushed to the hospital, he succumbed to his injuries. The police have identified the suspected assailants and are actively investigating the case, signaling a deep dive into the circumstances surrounding the incident.

articles.title: 'Laila' Twitter REVIEW: Here's how fans react to Vishvak Sen's film; Check HERE
articles.description: Laila Twitter Review: Vishwak Sen, known for his controversial movie releases, is back with another experimental film, Laila. Premieres were held abroad, and audience reactions are pouring in on Twitter. How did the movie fare? Vishwak Sen, a young Telugu hero with a unique image, is known for his experimental films. His latest experiment is Laila, a comedy entertainer produced by Sahu Garapati under Shine Screens. Starring Vishwak Sen and Akanksha Sharma, with a supporting cast including Kamakshi Bhaskar, Vennela Kishore, and others, the film is directed by Ram Narayan and is releasing amidst controversy Several celebrities wished Vishwak Sen good luck for Laila on Twitter, notably Sai Dharam Tej, who expressed his excitement for the film and wished the team a blockbuster success One viewer tweeted that Vishwak Sen's performance was the highlight of the first half, praising his comedy and the supporting cast Another netizen found the first half unimpressive, calling it a waste of time and criticizing the artificial comedy, preferring Varun Tej's Matka Some viewers found the film overall decent, praising Vishwak Sen's daring performance in a female getup and calling it a one-man show Overall, the initial response has been mixed. While Vishwak Sen's performance in a female getup is commendable, the story lacks depth. The film's success remains to be seen

articles.title: Double benefit! New Rs 1,000 allowance launched alongside Lakshmi Bhandar; apply now
articles.description: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced great news for the women of West Bengal. In addition to the Lakshmi Bhandar scheme, the West Bengal government will provide an additional Rs 1,000. How to avail this benefit? Mamata Banerjee shares good news, bringing smiles to the faces of women in West Bengal. What did she announce? She introduced a new scheme for the state. In addition to the Lakshmi Bhandar scheme, the West Bengal government will now provide an extra Rs 1,000 to the women of the state. Mamata Banerjee stated that until now, under the Lakshmi Bhandar scheme, general category women received Rs 1,000 per month, and reserved category women received Rs 1,200 per month. Now, in addition to the Lakshmi Bhandar amount, the West Bengal government will provide an extra Rs 1,000 to the women of the state. Let's find out the name of this special scheme by the state government. How to apply for this scheme? What is the application deadline? When will the funds be disbursed? Mamata Banerjee's new initiative aims to improve the lives of senior citizens in the state. The West Bengal government has launched a special scheme for senior citizens aged 60 and above, called the Old Age Pension Scheme. Under this scheme, senior citizens aged 60 and above in our state receive a monthly pension of Rs 1,000. Senior citizens covered under this scheme receive a monthly pension of Rs 1,000, directly deposited into their bank accounts by the state government.

articles.title: Modi's Diplomatic Tour: Strengthening India-USA Relations
articles.description: Modi's Diplomatic Tour: Strengthening India-USA Relations Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded a diplomatic visit to the United States, marked by high-level discussions with President Donald Trump on crucial issues. The talks covered aspects like trade, defence, and technological collaboration, showcasing a commitment to broad-base strategic ties between India and the US.Modi's visit, a priority for both nations, followed his turn in France, where he attended the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit co-chaired with President Emmanuel Macron. In the US, Modi's interactions extended to high-profile figures, including SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, and underscored the commitment to strengthening bilateral relations with talks on defence supplies, including F-35 fighter jets.The discussions emphasized a shared vision for prosperity and reciprocal economic ties, as Modi highlighted India's goals translating to American prosperity. This diplomacy echoes the intent to deepen engagements in pivotal global and regional platforms, securing India‚Äôs strategic interest.
